contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Homecoming | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[America (band)|America]] | Cover = AmericaHomecoming.jpg | Released = November 15, 1972 | Recorded = 1972 | Genre = [[Folk rock]] | Length = 33:06 | Label = [[Warner Bros. Records|Warner Bros.]] | Producer = America | Last album = ''[[America (America album)|America]]''<br />(1971) | This album = '''''Homecoming'''''<br />(1972) | Next album = ''[[Hat Trick (album)|Hat Trick]]''<br />(1973) }} '''''Homecoming''''' is a 1972 (see [[1972 in music]]) album by [[America (band)|America]]. [[Steel-string guitar|Acoustic guitar]]-based, with a more pronounced [[electric guitar]] and [[Keyboard instrument|keyboard]] section than their first album, their second effort helped continue America's success, and includes one of their best known hits, "[[Ventura Highway]]". ''Homecoming'' peaked at #9 on [[Billboard Music Charts|Billboard]]'s Pop Albums chart and was certified platinum by the [[RIAA]]. It produced three hit singles: "[[Ventura Highway]]" which peaked at #8 on the Billboard singles chart and #3 on the Adult Contemporary chart; "Don't Cross the River" which hit #35 on Billboard and #23 on the Adult Contemporary chart; and "Only in Your Heart" peaked at #62 on Billboard's Pop singles chart. Several other songs received radio airplay on FM stations playing album tracks including "To Each His Own", "California Revisited", and "Cornwall Blank". ==Reception== {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|4|5}}<ref name="AM">{{Allmusic |class=album |tab=review |first=David |last=Cleary |title= ''Homecoming'' > Review |id=r514 |accessdate=August 15, 2011}}</ref> }} In his [[Allmusic]] review music critic David Cleary called ''Homecoming'' "America's finest album" and despite citing the lyrics as sometime banal, wrote that "each song here has something to recommend it. This top-flight album is a very rewarding listen."<ref name="AM" /> ==Track listing== # "[[Ventura Highway]]" - (Dewey Bunnell) 3:32 # "To Each His Own" - ([[Gerry Beckley]]) 3:13 # "Don't Cross the River" - ([[Dan Peek]]) 2:30 # "Moon Song" - (Bunnell) 3:41 # "Only in Your Heart" - (Beckley) 3:16 # "Till the Sun Comes Up Again" - (Beckley) 2:12 # "Cornwall Blank - (Bunnell) 4:19 # "Head & Heart" - ([[John Martyn (singer)|John Martyn]]) 3:49 # "California Revisited" - (Peek) 3:03 # "Saturn Nights" - (Peek) 3:31 ==Personnel== *[[Dan Peek]] - guitar, piano, vocals *[[Gerry Beckley]] - guitar, piano, vocals, bass on "Till the Sun Comes Up Again" and "Head & Heart" *Dewey Bunnell - guitar, piano, vocals, percussion on "Head & Heart" *[[Joe Osborn]] - bass *[[Hal Blaine]] - percussion, drums *[[Gary Mallaber]] - drums and percussion on "Till the Sun Comes Up Again" *Gary Burden - art direction, design *[[Henry Diltz]] - banjo, photography *Bill Halverson - engineer *Lee Herschberg - mastering *Chuck Leary - assistant engineer *[[Mike Stone]] - engineer ==References== {{reflist}} {{America (band)}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Homecoming (America Album)}} [[Category:America (band) albums]] [[Category:1972 albums]] [[Category:Warner Bros. Records albums]] [[pt:Homecoming (Ã¡lbum)]]
